Description: A concurrent resolution granting authority for adjournment for more than 2 days.Last Action: REFERRED TO SECRETARY FOR RECORD

A concurrent resolution to waive the legislative notice requirement for increases in rates of compensation for certain employees in the state classified service.Last Action: reported with recommendation without amendment

A concurrent resolution to urge the Michigan Department of Natural Resources, in coordination with the U.S. Department of the Interior and the federal government, to re-establish a viable and self-sustaining wolf population in the Lower Peninsula.Last Action: referred to Committee on Natural Resources, Environment, Tourism and Outdoor Recreation

A concurrent resolution prescribing the Joint Convention Rules for the Legislature.Last Action: REFERRED TO SECRETARY FOR RECORD

A concurrent resolution calling on the Archivist of the United States to certify and publish the Equal Rights Amendment as the Twenty-Eighth Amendment to the United States Constitution and calling on the United States Congress to declare the Equal Rights Amendment ratified.Last Action: REFERRED TO COMMITTEE ON GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

A concurrent resolution to urge Congress to amend 38 USC § 5304 and 10 USC § 12316 to permit members of the United States reserves and National Guard to receive full or partial active service pay in tandem with disability compensation from the Department of Veterans Affairs.Last Action: reported with recommendation without amendment

A concurrent resolution to oppose the designation of additional federal wilderness areas in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula and to urge the United States Congress to declare the entire city of Ann Arbor a wilderness area.Last Action: referred to Committee on Government Operations

A concurrent resolution to urge the Michigan Supreme Court to amend the Code of Judicial Conduct to require Michigan judges to make broader financial disclosures.Last Action: referred to Committee on Government Operations
